script:
{{info.comment}}

{% if info.sequence %} {% endif %} {% if info.ms.target %} {% endif %}
Sequence {{info.sequence}}
MF {{rendertype(info.mf,'mf')}}
Monoisotoic mass {{info.em|number_format(4)}}
Composition {% for part in info.parts %} {% if part %} {% endif %} {% endfor %}
{{part}}
Ionization {{rendertype(info.ms.ionization,'')}}
Expected observed mass {{info.ms.em|number_format(4)}}
Closest experimental m/z {{info.ms.target.mass|number_format(4)}} {% if info.ms.similarity.quantity %} ({{rendertype(info.ms.similarity.quantity,{numeral:'0.00%'})}}) {% endif %}
{{rendertype(info.ms.delta*1000,{numeral:'0.00'})}} mDa ({{rendertype(info.ms.ppm,{numeral:'0.00'})}} ppm)
Charge {{info.ms.charge}}

Molecule and fragment generation

Mixture ApmS Peptidic sequence AomS Nucleic sequence
You can specify a list of allowed fragments and the system will combine them and generate all the possibilites 
            H (CH2CH2O)0-100
            H,Me,Et,Ph
This tool allows to copy / paste directly a sequence of amino sequence as a one letter or 3 letters code. You may also use sequence copied directly fromUniProtorPdblike for example: 
        SEQRES   1 A 1020  MET LEU SER ALA HIS GLN TRP LEU ARG HIS CYS ILE ILE
        SEQRES   2 A 1020  GLY VAL ALA SER VAL ALA LEU LEU GLN ALA CYS SER LYS 
        SEQRES   3 A 1020  GLN THR GLY ASN GLU SER SER SER SER ALA LYS SER ALA
                10         20         30         40         50         60 
        MRAMRLRDTT AVAHTLGRKV YSSLKRAAVN NLDLFAGGAA AGAVLLHLLD DVHAAGDLAE
The system also allows a 1 letter code for nucleotide sequence.
MF range

name: LoadPrefs
script:
const modulePrefsManager=API.cache('modulePrefsManager');
modulePrefsManager.reloadModulePrefs(value);
